00040 #ifndef _physeventmanager_cpp
00041 #define _physeventmanager_cpp
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //This will capture all event and store them for easy dispatching.
00044 //
00045 //There will be an instance of this class in the physworld.
00046 ///////////////////////////////////////
00047 
00048 #include "physworld.h"
00049 #include "physeventmanager.h"
00050 #include "SDL.h"
00051 
00052 int PhysSDLFilter( const RawEvent *event );
00053 
00054 bool PhysEventManager::IgnoreSDLQuitEvents;
00055 
00056 /// @todo TODO: Make the PhysEventManager completely thread safe. IF this is completely thread safe, we can spawn numerous individual thread each accessing this and
00057 /// and the performance gain would almost scale directly with cpu core count increases. Look at boost scoped_lock
00058 
00059 PhysEventManager::PhysEventManager(PhysWorld* ParentWorld_)
00060 {
00061     ParentWorld = ParentWorld_;
00062     SetIgnoreQuitEvents(false);
00063     SDL_SetEventFilter( PhysSDLFilter );
00064 }
00065 
00066 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00067 //These functions will give you the next event or help you manage the events
00068 ///////////////////////////////////////
00069 unsigned int PhysEventManager::GetRemainingEventCount()
00070 {
00071     return EventQueue.size();
00072 }
00073 
00074 PhysEvent* PhysEventManager::GetNextEvent()
00075 {
00076     if(EventQueue.size()==0)
00077     {
00078             return 0;
00079     }
00080     PhysEvent* results = EventQueue.front();
00081     return results;
00082 }
00083 
00084 PhysEvent* PhysEventManager::PopNextEvent()
00085 {
00086     if(EventQueue.size()==0)
00087     {
00088             return 0;
00089     }
00090     PhysEvent* results = EventQueue.front();
00091     EventQueue.pop_front();
00092     return results;
00093 }
00094 
00095 void PhysEventManager::RemoveNextEvent()
00096 {
00097     EventQueue.pop_front();
00098 }
00099 
00100 void PhysEventManager::AddEvent(PhysEvent* EventToAdd)
00101 {
00102     EventQueue.push_back(EventToAdd);
00103 }
00104 
00105 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00106 // Filtered management functions - You choose YAYYYY!!!
00107 ///////////////////////////////////////
00108 PhysEvent* PhysEventManager::GetNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::EventType SpecificType)
00109 {
00110     PhysEvent* results = 0;
00111     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00112     {
00113         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00114         {
00115             results = (*Iter);
00116             return results;
00117         }
00118     }
00119     return results;
00120 }
00121 
00122 PhysEvent* PhysEventManager::PopNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::EventType SpecificType)
00123 {
00124     PhysEvent* results = 0;
00125     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00126     {
00127         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00128         {
00129             results = (*Iter);
00130             EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00131             return results;
00132         }
00133     }
00134     return results;
00135 }
00136 
00137 void PhysEventManager::RemoveNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::EventType SpecificType)
00138 {
00139     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00140     {
00141         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00142         {
00143             EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00144         }
00145     }
00146 }
00147 
00148 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00149 // Filtered management functions - RenderTime Events
00150 ///////////////////////////////////////
00151 PhysEventRenderTime* PhysEventManager::GetNextRenderTimeEvent()
00152 {
00153     return dynamic_cast<PhysEventRenderTime*> (this->GetNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::RenderTime));
00154 }
00155 
00156 PhysEventRenderTime* PhysEventManager::PopNextRenderTimeEvent()
00157 {
00158     return dynamic_cast<PhysEventRenderTime*> (this->PopNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::RenderTime));
00159 }
00160 
00161 void PhysEventManager::RemoveNextRenderTimeEvent()
00162 {
00163     this->RemoveNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::RenderTime);
00164 }
00165

00170 PhysEventUserInput* PhysEventManager::GetNextUserInputEvent()
00171 {
00172     return dynamic_cast<PhysEventUserInput*> (this->GetNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::UserInput));
00173 }
00174 
00175 PhysEventUserInput* PhysEventManager::PopNextUserInputEvent()
00176 {
00177     return dynamic_cast<PhysEventUserInput*> (this->PopNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::UserInput));
00178 }
00179 
00180 void PhysEventManager::RemoveNextUserInputEvent()
00181 {
00182     this->RemoveNextSpecificEvent(PhysEvent::UserInput);
00183 }

00185 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00186 // Other functions
00187 ///////////////////////////////////////
00188 
00189 void PhysEventManager::AddPollingCheck(const MetaCode &InputToTryPolling)
00190 {
00191         bool ItFailed = true;
00192         int Code = InputToTryPolling.GetCode();
00193 
00194         //Check for keyboard code
00195         if ( MetaCode::KEY_LAST > Code && Code > MetaCode::KEY_FIRST)
00196         {
00197             this->WatchKeyboardKeys.push_back(Code);
00198             ItFailed=false;
00199         }
00200 
00201         //if it is a specific mouse button, then
00202         if ( MetaCode::MOUSEBUTTON == Code)
00203         {
00204             this->WatchMouseKeys.push_back(InputToTryPolling.GetID());
00205             ItFailed=false;
00206         }
00207 
00208         if (ItFailed)
00209             this->ParentWorld->LogAndThrow("Unsupported Polling Check on this Platform");
00210 }
00211 
00212 PhysEventUserInput* PhysEventManager::PollForUserInputEvents()
00213 {
00214         this->ParentWorld->Log("Polling logic not writted yet");
00215         PhysEventUserInput* test = new PhysEventUserInput();
00216         return test;
00217 }

00219 bool PhysEventManager::DoQuitMessagesExist()
00220 {
00221         return false;//This is system dependent. since we are using SDL, There is no real quit message.
00222 }
00223 
00224 bool PhysEventManager::IgnoreQuitEvents()
00225 {
00226     return IgnoreSDLQuitEvents;
00227 }
00228 
00229 void PhysEventManager::SetIgnoreQuitEvents(bool Ignore)
00230 {
00231     IgnoreSDLQuitEvents=Ignore;
00232 }
00233 
00234 int PhysSDLFilter( const RawEvent *event )
00235 {
00236      if ( !PhysEventManager::IgnoreQuitEvents() && event->type == SDL_QUIT)
00237         { return 0; }
00238      return 1;
00239 }
